case_title: Mrs. LILAVATI HARCHANDANI vs MONICA KAMRAN DOST and others
complaint_summary: Petitioner alleged improper election procedure and violation of mandatory rules by the Returning Officer, resulting in an incorrect declaration of the elected member.
investigation_summary: The tribunal examined the petitioner, her election agent, the elected member, and the Returning Officer. Relevant documents and ballot papers were reviewed.
judgment_summary: The tribunal found that the Returning Officer failed to comply with mandatory provisions of Rule 66(5) of the Representation of People (Conduct of Election) Rules, 1977. The election was declared void, and fresh elections were ordered.
punishment: Election set aside; fresh elections ordered.
Decision_or_verdict: Election declared void due to procedural violations.
legal_arguments: Mandatory nature of Rule 66(5) under proportional representation voting.
Violation of election rules constitutes an illegal act under Section 70(a) of the Representation of People Act, 1976.
Consent to the lot-drawing procedure was not proven.
statutes: Houses of Parliament and Provincial Assemblies (Election) Order, 1977

witness_statement.Mrs. Lilavati Harchandani: Objected to the lot-drawing procedure and claimed violation of election rules.
witness_statement.Mr. P.K. Shahani: Supported the petitioner's objections and stated facts from the election petition.
witness_statement.Mrs. Monica Kamran Dost: Defended the lot-drawing procedure as compliant with Rule 66(5).
witness_statement.Mr. M.H. Zaidi: Admitted procedural errors and provided evidence of ballot papers.

key_issues: Compliance with Rule 66(5) of Representation of People (Conduct of Election) Rules, 1977.
Mandatory vs. directory interpretation of election rules.

maxims.Expressio unius alterius exclusio: Express mention of one thing implies exclusion of another.

legal_terms.Proportional Representation: Voting system where votes are allocated based on preferences.
legal_terms.Single Transferable Vote: Voting method allowing ranking of candidates.

words_and_phrases.Mandatory provisions: Rules that must be strictly followed.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around procedural violations in an election for a reserved seat in the Provincial Assembly of Sind. The tribunal declared the election void due to non-compliance with mandatory rules for proportional representation voting. Fresh elections were ordered.
